title: Linear momentum - position function of block

content.question: A block with a mass of <math alttext="2.0 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi></math> starts from rest and begins to move along the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-axis at time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> according to the equation <math alttext="x equals one half t cubed" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></math>, where <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math> is the block’s position, in meters, and <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> is the time, in seconds. What is the momentum of the block at time <math alttext="t equals 4.0 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="16 kilogram meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>16</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi><mo>·</mo><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="24 kilogram meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>24</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi><mo>·</mo><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="48 kilogram meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>48</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi><mo>·</mo><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="64 kilogram meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>64</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi><mo>·</mo><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="48 kilogram meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>48</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi><mo>·</mo><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
